titleStmt.title: X-ray Excited Optical Luminescence (XEOL) -detected XAFS investigation of novel luminescent copper clusters confined in SAPOs microporous frameworks Experiment number: CH-6247

analytic.title: X-ray Excited Optical Luminescence (XEOL) -detected XAFS investigation of novel luminescent copper clusters confined in SAPOs microporous frameworks Experiment number: CH-6247

div.head: Report:
div.p: We collected simultaneously the XEOL-and transmission-detected XAFS of eleven copperbased luminescent samples at the Cu-K edge. Six were measured in capillaries due to their air sensitivity, and the remaining five stable samples were measured as pellets.
No particular difficulties or technical issues were encountered during this experiment. The collected data has been analysed and is currently being included in a manuscript and a PhD thesis.
Representative transmission-and XEOL-detected XANES spectra for a Cu zeolite with different contents pointing out the good quality of the recorded data are presented in Fig. 1.

figure.figDesc: Names and affiliations of applicants(* indicates experimentalists): Dr. Grandjean Didier*, QSP, KU Leuven Romolini Giacomo*, KU Leuven Prof. Johan Hofkens, KU Leuven Prof. Peter Lievens, KU Leuven Dr. Francesco d'Acapito,* BM8@ESRF

figure.head: Figure
figure.figDesc: Figure 1: XANES spectra of Cu-zeolite; transmission detected (a); XEOL-detected (b)
